BAFTA 2026: 'One Battle After Another' leads; see full list of nominations
description: The excitement is palpable as the 2026 BAFTA nominations have just been announced! Leading the charge is Paul Thomas Anderson's compelling drama 'One Battle After Another' with an impressive 14 nominations, while the intense narrative of Ryan Coogler's 'Sinners' follows closely behind with 13 nods. These awards shine a spotlight on the incredible creativity in both British and international films.

'Aye! Who's screaming DK, DK': Sidda loses cool as youth leaders chant DKS slogans
description: Karnataka chief minister Siddaramaiah lost his temper at a rally when Youth Congress workers chanted slogans for deputy CM DK Shivakumar. Despite his requests for quiet, the disruptions continued, overshadowing the protest against a new rural employment scheme. This incident highlights the ongoing power struggle between the two leaders within the state Congress.

'Remove your perfume & tie your hair': Historian recounts 'strange' experience at this Delhi tomb
description: Historian Eric Chopra explores Delhi's haunted sites, focusing on the enigmatic tomb of Jamali and Kamali.  Despite local warnings of djinns, Chopra experienced a profound sense of peace and love within the tomb, highlighting the enduring power of bonds that transcend death.

Protests, PIL and campus pushback: Why UGC's equity rules have opened a can of worms
description: UGC’s 2026 equity regulations, notified January 13, have triggered student protests from Delhi to Lucknow, political heat, and a Supreme Court PIL targeting Regulation 3(1)(c). It defines caste-based discrimination as discrimination against SC, ST and OBC members. Protesters fear misuse, burden-of-proof issues and “surveillance” via Equity Squads, while the Centre says misuse won’t be allowed and clarifications are coming soon.

Jos Buttler scripts history, becomes only the second player to…
description: Jos Buttler achieved a significant milestone, becoming the second England player to play 400 international matches during the third ODI against Sri Lanka.  The wicketkeeper-batter has amassed over 12,000 international runs, solidifying his status as a key white-ball player. Buttler is also slated to participate in the ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2026.

title: ‘Only one in country taking on BJP’: Akhilesh meets Mamata, says she’ll become CM again
Tamil Nadu assembly election: Can Vijay's TVK convert fan frenzy into votes?
description: Actor Vijay's foray into Tamil Nadu politics with his party TVK mirrors past celebrity transitions, but his decision to quit films entirely sets him apart. While his fan base is large and organized, the success of TVK hinges on converting this popularity into votes, a challenge that has tripped up other stars.

'Turmoil in global environment': PM Modi's 'double engine' pitch after India-EU 'historic' FTA
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi announced a historic free trade agreement between India and the European Union, emphasizing a "double engine" growth approach amid global turmoil. This "biggest free trade agreement" aims to provide stability and common prosperity, unlocking new opportunities for India's labor-intensive products and service sectors.

The day Djokovic broke the Federer–Nadal duopoly — and began rewriting tennis history
description: Eighteen years ago, a 20-year-old Novak Djokovic achieved his first Grand Slam title at the Australian Open, ending the Federer-Nadal dominance. This victory marked the start of his record-breaking career, now spanning almost two decades and 24 major titles. Still competing at 38, Djokovic continues to chase further historical achievements.

India-EU FTA: Rs 6.4 lakh crore export boost for us, says Piyush Goyal
description: India and the European Union have inked a historic Free Trade Agreement after two decades of talks, boosting bilateral economic ties amid global uncertainty. This comprehensive pact grants India unprecedented market access for over 99% of its exports to the EU, significantly benefiting labour-intensive sectors and MSMEs, while also enhancing services and mobility for professionals.

title: One battle after another: How Revanth Reddy govt has BRS pinned down in Telangana
Snow leopard mauls tourist after she gets close to take photo; chilling video emerges
India-EU trade deal sealed: Why won't FTA be signed today?
description: India and the European Union have concluded talks for a free trade agreement. This landmark deal promises expanded market access for Indian exports and lower tariffs for EU goods. The agreement will now undergo legal review and ratification. Formal signing is anticipated later this year, with implementation likely in early 2027.

title: Mumbai’s two airports to be connected in 30–35 minutes with metro’s Gold Line
'He deserves another chance': Ex-India captain's message to Agarkar over Sarfaraz
description: Sarfaraz Khan is making a strong case for a return to the Indian team with exceptional domestic performances after a period of transformation. His recent prolific run-scoring, including a 227 in the Ranji Trophy, has garnered attention. Encouragement from former captain Mohammad Azharuddin, who praised his attacking intent and desire to learn, further bolsters his prospects for another opportunity.

'Moral duty': UP officer quits after Shankaracharya's remarks on PM Modi and CM Yogi
description: A Uttar Pradesh GST Deputy Commissioner in Ayodhya, Prashant Kumar Singh, has resigned citing moral reasons and support for CM Yogi Adityanath and PM Narendra Modi. Singh stated he was deeply hurt by allegations against the leaders and felt it was his duty to take a stand. He plans to engage in social work after his resignation is accepted.

Why 2026 could be India’s private space take-off year
description: India's 2026 space calendar is marked by a surge in private sector involvement, despite an early launch setback. Key milestones include a major Earth Observation Satellite System project and the development of 31 satellites for strategic surveillance by private entities. Rocket startups are poised for commercial launches, signaling a new era for India's space economy.

title: No tariffs on gems, jewellery, plastic: How will ‘mother of all deals’ with EU benefit India — Explained
description: The European Union ranks among India’s largest trading partners. The bilateral trade between the two in goods and services has risen steadily in recent years.

title: OpenAI VP Matt Knight shares resignation note on X; CEO Sam Altman replies
description: OpenAI's Chief Information Security Officer, Matt Knight, has stepped down after over five years. Knight, the company's first security hire in 2020, oversaw the growth of its security program to protect a global platform used by millions. He expressed pride in defining AI security and launching the Aardvark project. CEO Sam Altman lauded Knight's significant contributions.

title: Anthropic CEO to Zuckerberg: You are wrong to let godfather of Al Yann LeCun leave Meta
description: Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei subtly criticized social media entrepreneurs' approach to AI development, contrasting it with scientists' sense of responsibility. This comes as Meta's AI pioneer Yann LeCun departed following disagreements with Mark Zuckerberg over research direction, particularly concerning world models versus large language models. LeCun's exit and subsequent venture highlight a growing divergence in AI philosophies.

title: Travis Kelce supports Taylor Swift amid legal troubles as wedding plans pause
description: Travis Kelce has become a steady source of support for Taylor Swift as she navigates emotional strain linked to ongoing legal troubles around her inner circle. While staying publicly silent, Swift has leaned on Kelce’s guidance to protect her peace, set boundaries, and address personal tensions directly, even as wedding plans remain on pause.

title: Microsoft and Amazon together take out a full-page ad; point to 'emergency' in Washington
description: Tech giants Microsoft and Amazon, usually fierce rivals, have united to address Washington State's housing crisis.  The companies jointly penned an Op-Ed and took out a full-page ad, highlighting their $1.6 billion commitment to affordable housing. They urge policymakers to simplify building regulations to combat the severe shortage.

title: Anna Kupp sparks debate wearing Seahawks coat against Rams in NFC showdown
description: Cooper Kupp’s NFC Championship appearance against his former Rams blended football and family into one powerful moment. Now with the Seahawks, the Super Bowl MVP faced his past while drawing strength from his wife Anna and their three sons. The matchup symbolized resilience, loyalty, and a fresh chapter driven by purpose.

title: Patrick Mahomes rehabs quietly as Brittany Mahomes ensures stability for their kids
description: Patrick Mahomes is enduring a demanding offseason as he recovers from an ACL and LCL tear, limiting his usual family routine. While he focuses on rehabilitation and a possible Week 1 return, Brittany Mahomes is creating joyful moments for their children, helping maintain normalcy as the Chiefs star patiently works through recovery.
